intro: Dionysia cristagalli, commonly known as the cristata dionysia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native region.
